  • Reference

Trains models from given engines

Source: R/train_models.R
train_models.Rd

Trains models from given engines

train_models(data, y, engine, type)

Arguments

data

test data for models created by `prepare_data`
y

string, target column for predictions
engine

a vector of tree-based models that shall be testes. Possible values are: `ranger`, `xgboost`,`decision_tree`, `lightgbm`, `catboost`.
type

string, determines if future task is `classification` or `regression`

Value

list of models for every engine

Examples

data(iris)
iris_bin <- iris[1:100,]
type <- guess_type(iris_bin,'Species')

#> Error in guess_type(iris_bin, "Species"): nie udało się znaleźć funkcji 'guess_type'
preprocessed_data <- preprocessing(iris_bin, 'Species')

#> Error in preprocessing(iris_bin, "Species"): nie udało się znaleźć funkcji 'preprocessing'
split_data <- train_test_balance(preprocessed_data,'Species',type = type,balance = FALSE)

#> Error in train_test_balance(preprocessed_data, "Species", type = type,     balance = FALSE): nie udało się znaleźć funkcji 'train_test_balance'
train_data <- prepare_data(split_data$train, 'Species', c('ranger','xgboost','decision_tree'))

#> Error in split_data$train: obiekt typu 'closure' nie jest ustawialny
test_data <- prepare_data(split_data$test, 'Species', c('ranger','xgboost','decision_tree'), TRUE)

#> Error in split_data$test: obiekt typu 'closure' nie jest ustawialny
model <- train_models(train_data, 'Species', c('ranger','xgboost','decision_tree'), type = type)

#> Error in train_models(train_data, "Species", c("ranger", "xgboost", "decision_tree"),     type = type): nie udało się znaleźć funkcji 'train_models'
